segment.source: How to Configure a Domain User or Group
segment.target: How to Configure a Domain User or Group

segment.source: How to Configure a Domain User or Group
segment.target: How to Configure a Domain User or Group

segment.source: How to Configure a Domain User or Group
segment.target: How to Configure a Domain User or Group

segment.source: The deployment settings enable you to control which users or groups can access the MED-V workspace, as well as how long the MED-V workspace can be utilized and whether it can be used offline.
segment.target: The deployment settings enable you to control which users or groups can access the MED-V workspace, as well as how long the MED-V workspace can be utilized and whether it can be used offline.

segment.source: You can also configure additional rules to control access between the MED-V workspace and the host.
segment.target: You can also configure additional rules to control access between the MED-V workspace and the host.

segment.source: All MED-V workspace permissions are configured in the Policy module, on the Deployment tab.
segment.target: All MED-V workspace permissions are configured in the Policy module, on the Deployment tab.

segment.source: To allow users to utilize the MED-V workspace, you must first add domain users or groups to the MED-V workspace permissions.
segment.target: To allow users to utilize the MED-V workspace, you must first add domain users or groups to the MED-V workspace permissions.

segment.source: You can then set permissions for each user or group.
segment.target: You can then set permissions for each user or group.

segment.source: How to Add a Domain User or Group
segment.target: How to Add a Domain User or Group

segment.source: To add a domain user or group
segment.target: To add a domain user or group

segment.source: In the Users / Groups window, click Add.
segment.target: In the Users / Groups window, click Add.

segment.source: In the Enter User or Group names dialog box, select domain users or groups by doing one of the following:
segment.target: In the Enter User or Group names dialog box, select domain users or groups by doing one of the following:

segment.source: In the Enter User or Group names field, type a user or group that exists in the domain or as a local user or group on the computer.
segment.target: In the Enter User or Group names field, type a user or group that exists in the domain or as a local user or group on the computer.

segment.source: Then click Check Names to resolve it to the full existent name.
segment.target: Then click Check Names to resolve it to the full existent name.

segment.source: Click Find to open the standard Select Users or Groups dialog box.
segment.target: Click Find to open the standard Select Users or Groups dialog box.

segment.source: Then select domain users or groups.
segment.target: Then select domain users or groups.

segment.source: Click OK.
segment.target: Click OK.

segment.source: The domain users or groups are added.
segment.target: The domain users or groups are added.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Users from trusted domains should be added manually.
segment.target: Users from trusted domains should be added manually.

segment.source: Warning
segment.target: Warning

segment.source: Do not run the management application from a computer that is part of a domain that is not trusted by the domain the server is installed on.
segment.target: Do not run the management application from a computer that is part of a domain that is not trusted by the domain the server is installed on.

segment.source: How to Remove a Domain User or Group
segment.target: How to Remove a Domain User or Group

segment.source: To remove a domain user or group
segment.target: To remove a domain user or group

segment.source: In the Users / Groups window, select a user or group.
segment.target: In the Users / Groups window, select a user or group.

segment.source: Click Remove.
segment.target: Click Remove.

segment.source: The user or group is deleted.
segment.target: The user or group is deleted.

segment.source: How to Set Permissions for a User or a Group
segment.target: How to Set Permissions for a User or a Group

segment.source: To set permissions for a user or a group
segment.target: To set permissions for a user or a group

segment.source: Click the user or group for which you are setting the permissions.
segment.target: Click the user or group for which you are setting the permissions.

segment.source: Configure the MED-V workspace properties as described in the following table.
segment.target: Configure the MED-V workspace properties as described in the following table.

segment.source: On the Policy menu, select Commit.
segment.target: On the Policy menu, select Commit.

segment.source: Workspace Deployment Properties
segment.target: Workspace Deployment Properties

segment.source: Property Description General
segment.target: Property Description General

segment.source: Enable Workspace for user or group
segment.target: Enable Workspace for user or group

segment.source: Select this check box to enable the MED-V workspace for this user or group.
segment.target: Select this check box to enable the MED-V workspace for this user or group.

segment.source: Workspace expires on this date
segment.target: Workspace expires on this date

segment.source: Select this check box to assign an expiration date for the permissions set for this user or group.
segment.target: Select this check box to assign an expiration date for the permissions set for this user or group.

segment.source: When selected, the date box is enabled.
segment.target: When selected, the date box is enabled.

segment.source: Set the date, and permissions will expire at the end of the date specified.
segment.target: Set the date, and permissions will expire at the end of the date specified.

segment.source: Offline work is restricted to
segment.target: Offline work is restricted to

segment.source: Select this check box to assign a time period in which the policy must be refreshed for this user or group.
segment.target: Select this check box to assign a time period in which the policy must be refreshed for this user or group.

segment.source: When selected, the time period box is enabled.
segment.target: When selected, the time period box is enabled.

segment.source: Set the number of days or hours, and at the end of the specified time period, the user or group will not be able to connect if the policy is not refreshed.
segment.target: Set the number of days or hours, and at the end of the specified time period, the user or group will not be able to connect if the policy is not refreshed.

segment.source: Workspace deletion options
segment.target: Workspace deletion options

segment.source: Click to set the MED-V workspace deletion options.
segment.target: Click to set the MED-V workspace deletion options.

segment.source: For more information, see How to Set MED-V Workspace Deletion Options.
segment.target: For more information, see How to Set MED-V Workspace Deletion Options.

segment.source: Data Transfer
segment.target: Data Transfer

segment.source: Support clipboard between host and Workspace
segment.target: Support clipboard between host and Workspace

segment.source: Select this check box to enable copying and pasting between the host and the MED-V workspace.
segment.target: Select this check box to enable copying and pasting between the host and the MED-V workspace.

segment.source: Support file transfer between the host and Workspace
segment.target: Support file transfer between the host and Workspace

segment.source: Select this check box to enable transferring files between the host and MED-V workspace.
segment.target: Select this check box to enable transferring files between the host and MED-V workspace.

segment.source: Select one of the following options from the File Transfer box:
segment.target: Select one of the following options from the File Transfer box:

segment.source: Both—Enable transferring files between the host and the MED-V workspace.
segment.target: Both—Enable transferring files between the host and the MED-V workspace.

segment.source: Host to Workspace—Enable transferring files from the host to the MED-V workspace.
segment.target: Host to Workspace—Enable transferring files from the host to the MED-V workspace.

segment.source: Workspace to Host—Enable transferring files from the MED-V workspace to the host.
segment.target: Workspace to Host—Enable transferring files from the MED-V workspace to the host.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: If a user without permissions attempts to transfer files, a window will appear prompting him to enter the credentials of a user with permissions to perform the file transfer.
segment.target: If a user without permissions attempts to transfer files, a window will appear prompting him to enter the credentials of a user with permissions to perform the file transfer.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: To support file transfer in Windows XP SP3, you must disable offline file synchronization by editing the registry as follows:
segment.target: To support file transfer in Windows XP SP3, you must disable offline file synchronization by editing the registry as follows:

segment.source: Advanced
segment.target: Advanced

segment.source: Click to set the advanced file transfer options.
segment.target: Click to set the advanced file transfer options.

segment.source: For more information, see How to Set Advanced File Transfer Options.
segment.target: For more information, see How to Set Advanced File Transfer Options.

segment.source: Device Control
segment.target: Device Control

segment.source: Enable printing to printers connected to the host
segment.target: Enable printing to printers connected to the host

segment.source: Select this check box to enable users to print from the MED-V workspace using the host printer.
segment.target: Select this check box to enable users to print from the MED-V workspace using the host printer.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: The printing is performed by the printers defined on the host.
segment.target: The printing is performed by the printers defined on the host.

segment.source: Enable access to CD / DVD
segment.target: Enable access to CD / DVD

segment.source: Select this check box to allow access to a CD or DVD drive from this MED-V workspace.
segment.target: Select this check box to allow access to a CD or DVD drive from this MED-V workspace.

segment.source: Multiple Memberships
segment.target: Multiple Memberships

segment.source: If the user is part of a group and permissions are applied to the user as well as to the group they are part of, all permissions are applied.
segment.target: If the user is part of a group and permissions are applied to the user as well as to the group they are part of, all permissions are applied.

segment.source: If the user is a member of two different groups, the least restrictive permissions are applied.
segment.target: If the user is a member of two different groups, the least restrictive permissions are applied.
